name: IOANNIS SAVVAIDIS
title: Computer Engineer and Composer
profile: Computer Engineer and Composer dedicated to building sustainable systems and exploring the intersection of technology and art. Experienced in managing large-scale production infrastructures with a focus on observability and performance while cultivating a culture of respect and collaboration.
artistBio: Composer drawing on Quantum and Distributed Computing principles to interpret relativistic reality with motion dynamics. Discography with record labels including Anopolis, June, Lower Parts, and Phormix. Performs live with synthesizers under an improvisational approach.
engineerBio: Computer Engineer with over a decade in Systems and Site Reliability Engineering, managing large-scale production infrastructures. Focused on systems performance, software engineering, and cultivating a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement. Interested in physics and music composition. Currently, pursuing a Master's in Quantum Computing.
artisticApproach: Drawing from a Computer Engineering background, emerged into music, experimenting with the concept of 'Tensor Music'. An approach that explores vector spaces and their interactions, shaping multidimensional spaces. Currently focused on 'Superluminal Motion', inspired by theoretical faster-than-light phenomena, where spacetime intersects across non-local states.

description: Sole SRE for half of my tenure, managing infrastructure stability across multiple AWS regions and supporting critical business operations
Introduced pre-commit hooks, conventional commits, and SRE practices
Served as primary contact for production incidents, creating RFCs and RCAs to enhance performance and facilitate troubleshooting
Streamlined the monitoring process by simplifying Prometheus/Grafana manifest deployment, adding dashboards, alerts, and runbooks for more effective observability and on-call response
Enhanced Cluster Autoscaler and AWS ASGs, improving spot instance reliability and enabling multi-zonal clustering
Leveraged monitoring insights to reorganize infrastructure and enhance scaling by creating dedicated node groups and fine-tuning ASG node sizes based on workload characterization
Reduced CloudWatch and EC2 costs by optimizing resource usage and configurations
Automated, documented, and led Kubernetes upgrades (1.21 → 1.26) on self-managed node groups, ensuring smooth workload migrations
Advocated for Product’s smoke testing, profiling, and microservices pattern
Initiated and led the SRE roadmap focusing on performance, observability, and release engineering improvements, and SLIs/SLOs adaption
SRE Advocate in DevOps team, to enable Observability
Introduced SRE principles to support product adaptation, presenting the SRE discipline to directors and stakeholders
Member of SRE team, managing infrastructure across multiple AWS regions (~500 instances) with over 70 microscervices and self-managed Kubernetes Clusters
Managed observability and release engineering, establishing centralized metrics, logging, tracing, and CI/CD systems with SLIs/SLOs
Led migration from Docker Registry and Chartmuseum to Harbor Registry
Developed CLI to deploy Prometheus and Grafana manifests with GitOps
Led SSO provisioning for AWS with OneLogin
Contributed to a Go-based orchestration tool for (~70) microservices CI/CD, enabling Kubernetes sandbox environments
Contributed to reducing alert noise and improving infrastructure documentation
First professional role managing large-scale on-prem VMware infrastructure ~(300 servers, 5 storage systems, 5K VMs across 3 DCs)
Maintained reverse proxies, DNS, Linux VM templates, and monitoring
Automated cost reporting and VM lifecycle management
Introduced resource tagging and openDCIM for infrastructure inventory
Led the migration of production traffic from Apache to NGINX farms
Designed the fist University’s IaaS Community Cloud as an extension of my bachelor’s dissertation
Delivered a private cloud using Synnefo (3 servers and 1 storage system), for academic compute and storage needs
